title: WhatsApp is putting contact editing inside the app and it's about time
description: The latest beta rolls out an in-app way to add new numbers to WhatsApp and a phone's contacts list right after.

title: Elon Musk's date for removing legacy  Blue checks on Twitter surprises no one
description: The Twitter CEO has set a final date for pulling all legacy blue verification checks.

title: watchos 10: Everything we know so far, rumors, and what to expect
description: Here’s when watchOS 10 is likely to arrive on your Apple Watch, and what changes it’ll bring.

title: Is this the fastest 3D printer ever made?
description: Its goal of democratizing 3D printers hasn't stopped Creality from showing off with lightning speeds.

title: The Marvels trailer is giving me the team-up vibes of the first Avengers movie
description: Accidental power-swapping shenanigans looks like it's bringing some The Avengers' fun, clashing vibe back to the MCU

title: I had ChatGPT write my college essay and now I'm ready to go back to school – and do nothing
description: ChatGPT is a brilliant college essayist, and there may be no way to unring that bell.

title: Raspberry Pi Code Editor wants to help the next generation of programmers
description: The Raspberry Pi Foundation is behind this new, free code editor to help support our future workforce.

title: Customer data stolen after ransomware attack on Yum! Brands
description: Names and driver's license numbers were among the data stolen in a January ransomware attack.

title: Your Android phone will soon get the iPhone's best storage-saving feature
description: Android phones will soon get a new 'auto-archiving' feature that'll let you reduce app storage space without deleting them.

title: Impressive Dead Space demake timewarps the Ishimura to 1998
description: A game designer has created a playable Dead Space demake demo, featuring chunky PS1-like visuals.

title: Alibaba now has a ChatGPT rival for its cloud customers to use
description: Alibaba has announced a new LLM that it hopes to integrate within its numerous services for cloud customers and beyond.

title: Google Bard is getting better at math, and more updates should be on the way
description: Google's Bard AI is getting better at math, and its new update page suggests we'll see it get a lot more updates in the future.

title: You no longer need a VR headset to enjoy Half-Life Alyx
description: The Half-Life Alyx NoVR mod has just released its biggest update, allowing players to enjoy the game’s campaign without a VR headset.

title: New MacBook Air 15-inch looks more likely than ever - but you may have to wait
description: According to reputable leaks, we are probably going to see a new MacBook in June, if that.

title: The UK wants nationwide 5G coverage by 2030
description: The government also pledged more money to boost growth at a “local level”.

title: Google fined for unfairly competing with rival app store
description: Google gets hit with a multimillion-dollar fine for anticompetitive practices in South Korea.

title: Google kills third-party smart displays – and its voice Assistant could be next
description: Google has ended software support for most of its third-party smart displays – and that spells more trouble for its Assistant.

title: Microsoft won't be axing this popular Exchange Online feature just yet
description: Organizations have been given a September 2024 deadline to migrate, but you should still update sooner rather than later.

title: Leaked iPhone 15 Pro dummy teases much-rumored design changes
description: A leaked iPhone 15 Pro model seemingly corroborates many of the design rumors we've already heard about the device.

title: Nintendo isn't messing around searching for the Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom leaker
description: Nintendo has filed a subpoena request to find the identity of the user responsible for the Tears of the Kingdom’s art book leaks.

title: We might get 14th-gen Intel CPUs as soon as this year, but there’s a catch

title: Windows 11 screenshots could soon work differently, breaking 30 years of tradition

title: SD Worx forced to pause operations following cyberattack
description: It's not a ransomware attack, the company confirms, adding that there's no evidence of data exfiltration.

title: US government orders its workers to update their iPhones immediately

title: Microsoft finally gets around to fixing half-decade-old Firefox CPU bug
description: Microsoft finally got around to fixing a high-CPU performance bug in Mozilla Firefox. It just took it half a decade to do so.
